gw.webservice

Class IUserAPI

  • gw.webservice.IUserAPI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject

    public class IUserAPI
implements _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject
    UserAPI is used to perform operations on users. This includes creating and modifying.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addRolesToUser(String userID, String[] roleIDs)
      Adds roles to an User. If an role is already belongs to the user, it's ignored.
      String addUser(User data, String[] rolePublicIds, String credentialName)
      Adds the given user to the system. This method is included for backwards compatibility but all new code should use the form of addUser that does not take a credentialName parameter.
      String addUser(User userData, String[] rolePublicIds)
      Adds the given user to the system. Only the contact field and credential properties are required. The user will be created and given the roles specified by the roles parameter. The Contact field should be set to an object of type UserContact, which should have at least its last name set. The Credential field should be set to an object of type Credential which should have the user name and password fields set. For example: User user = new User() UserContact userContact = new UserContact() userContact.FirstName = "John" userContact.LastName = "Smith" user.Contact = userContact Credential credential = new Credential() credential.UserName = "jsmith" credential.Password = "initialPassword" user.Credential = credential userAPI.addUser(user, new String[]{"rolex", "roley"})
      void addUserAsMemberOfGroup(String groupID, String userID)
      Adds the user as a member of the group. Both the user and group must already exist.
      void addUserAttributes(String userID, String[] attributeIDs)
      Adds attributes to an User.
      boolean doesExist(String publicId)
      Indicates whether the given user exists in the system.
      String findPublicIdByName(String userName)
      Finds the public id of a user by the user login name.
      User getUser(String userID)
      Retrieves a user given the user identifier
      boolean isUserMemberOfGroup(String groupID, String userID)
      Returns true if the user is a member of the group specified, false if not.
      void removeRolesFromUser(String userID, String[] roleIDs)
      Remove roles from a User. If any of the roles does not belongs to the user, it will be ignored.
      void removeUserAsMemberOfGroup(String groupID, String userID)
      Removes the user as a member of the group. Both the user and group must already exist.
      void removeUserAttributes(String userID, String[] attributeIDs)
      Remove attributes to an User. If an attribute does not belongs to the user, it's ignored.

      • getUser

        User getUser(String userID)
        Retrieves a user given the user identifier
        Parameters:
        userID -
        Returns:

      • addUser

        String addUser(User data,
             String[] rolePublicIds,
             String credentialName)
        Adds the given user to the system. This method is included for backwards compatibility but all new code should use the form of addUser that does not take a credentialName parameter.
        Parameters:
        data - The User object, which must have valid UserContact and Credential objects set as the contact and credential field.
        rolePublicIds - The roles to assign the user.
        credentialName - Ignored
        Returns:
        The public id of the new user

      • addUser

        String addUser(User userData,
             String[] rolePublicIds)
        Adds the given user to the system. Only the contact field and credential properties are required. The user will be created and given the roles specified by the roles parameter.

        The Contact field should be set to an object of type UserContact, which should have at least its last name set. The Credential field should be set to an object of type Credential which should have the user name and password fields set. For example: 

        User user = new User()
UserContact userContact = new UserContact()
userContact.FirstName = "John"
userContact.LastName = "Smith"
user.Contact = userContact
Credential credential = new Credential()
credential.UserName  = "jsmith"
credential.Password = "initialPassword"
user.Credential = credential
userAPI.addUser(user, new String[]{"rolex", "roley"})
        Parameters:
        userData - The User object, which must have valid UserContact and Credential objects set as the contact and credential field.
        rolePublicIds - The public ids of the roles to assign the user.
        Returns:
        The public id of the new user

      • addRolesToUser

        void addRolesToUser(String userID,
                  String[] roleIDs)
        Adds roles to an User. If an role is already belongs to the user, it's ignored.
        Parameters:
        userID - The ID of the user
        roleIDs - The public IDs of roles to be added.

      • removeRolesFromUser

        void removeRolesFromUser(String userID,
                       String[] roleIDs)
        Remove roles from a User. If any of the roles does not belongs to the user, it will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        userID - The ID of the user
        roleIDs - The public IDs of roles to be added. This may be null

      • addUserAttributes

        void addUserAttributes(String userID,
                     String[] attributeIDs)
        Adds attributes to an User.
        Parameters:
        userID - The ID of the user
        attributeIDs - attribute public IDs to be added

      • removeUserAttributes

        void removeUserAttributes(String userID,
                        String[] attributeIDs)
        Remove attributes to an User. If an attribute does not belongs to the user, it's ignored.
        Parameters:
        userID - The ID of the user
        attributeIDs - attribute public IDs to be removed

      • doesExist

        boolean doesExist(String publicId)
        Indicates whether the given user exists in the system.
        Parameters:
        publicId - The public identifier of the user in question.
        Returns:
        true if the user specified by the identifier exists in the system, false otherwise.

      • addUserAsMemberOfGroup

        void addUserAsMemberOfGroup(String groupID,
                          String userID)
        Adds the user as a member of the group. Both the user and group must already exist.
        Parameters:
        groupID - The identifier of the group.
        userID - The identifier of the user.

      • removeUserAsMemberOfGroup

        void removeUserAsMemberOfGroup(String groupID,
                             String userID)
        Removes the user as a member of the group. Both the user and group must already exist.
        Parameters:
        groupID - The identifier of the group.
        userID - The identifier of the user.

      • isUserMemberOfGroup

        boolean isUserMemberOfGroup(String groupID,
                          String userID)
        Returns true if the user is a member of the group specified, false if not.
        Parameters:
        groupID - The identifier of the group.
        userID - The identifier of the user.
        Returns:
        true if the user is a member of the group specified, false if not.

      • findPublicIdByName

        String findPublicIdByName(String userName)
        Finds the public id of a user by the user login name.
        Parameters:
        userName - the login name (credential name).
        Returns:
        the user's publicID, else null
